metadata.titel_preek: God Made Jesus to Be Sin

kernfrasen: The higher the price, the greater the sin
dominante_domeinen.conceptuele_metafoor: SIN IS DEBT / SALVATION IS AN ECONOMIC TRANSACTION
SALVATION IS A JOURNEY INTO THE DEPTHS

kernfrasen: unholy triumvirate of Sin, Death, and the Devil

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Jesus drank the dregs of abandonment

mapping_structuur.doel_element: The full experience of God's wrath/absence

cognitieve_implicaties: Suffering is a finite quantity that must be consumed entirely.
theologische_implicaties: The cup is empty for the believer; judgment is exhausted.
ethische_implicaties: Gratitude for the one who 'drank' on our behalf.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Portrays God as the one who prepared the poison/bitter drink.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: A standard biblical idiom (Cup of Wrath) used to emphasize the totality of the experience.

metafoor_inventaris.metafoor_expressie: Our iniquities have gone over my head... overwhelming us, crushing us, drowning us

cognitieve_implicaties: Sin is an external force that exerts pressure or suffocates.
theologische_implicaties: Total depravity; the inability to save oneself from drowning.
onbedoelde_consequenties: Sin as a 'substance' rather than a 'choice'.

metafoor_inventaris.vitaliteit_toelichting: The preacher revitalizes the 'weight' metaphor by combining it with the sensory experience of drowning.

coherentie_analyse.coherentie_verklaring: The preacher successfully links the Economic domain (weighing sin) with the Physical/Spatial domain (descending into the depths). The coherence is maintained by the central theme of 'Substitution'.

incoherentie_punten.locatie: Transition from Gethsemane to the Cross
incoherentie_punten.metafoor_a: MORAL LIFE IS WARFARE (battle with evil Power)
incoherentie_punten.conflict_beschrijving: The shift from Jesus as a warrior fighting a power to Jesus as a currency paying a debt creates a slight cognitive friction.
incoherentie_punten.entailment_conflict: A warrior defeats an enemy; a debtor satisfies a creditor. Is God the enemy or the creditor?

succesvolle_blending.blending_strategie: The preacher uses the 'Voice' of the Psalms as the bridge, allowing Jesus to 'speak instead of us' while carrying the 'burden'.

sterktes.beschrijving: Re-activating the source domain of 'weight' by referencing Levitical weighing of offerings.
sterktes.voorbeeld: In the time of the Old Testament, a guilt offering had to be weighed so that a value could be given to it.

risicos.beschrijving: Treating the 'Cry of Dereliction' as a literal ontological break in the Trinity.
risicos.voorbeeld: Now for the first time his communion with his Father in heaven is broken.
risicos.potentiele_impact: Could lead to a 'Social Trinitarianism' where the Godhead is divided.

text_world_analyse.primaire_wereld: The scene of the Crucifixion as viewed through the 'lens' of the Psalms.
sub_worlds: The study of the early disciples after the Resurrection
The internal psychological state of Jesus in Gethsemane

deictic_shifts.effectiviteit: High; creates empathy and historical continuity.

versterkte_schemas.hoe_versterkt: By emphasizing the 'exchange' of sin for righteousness.

verstoorde_schemas.verstoring_strategie: Spatial mapping of 'coming down into it'.

schema_analyse.liturgische_schema_aansluiting: Perfectly aligned with Good Friday (Tenebrae/Seven Last Words).

aanbevelingen.metafoor_audit_samenvatting: The sermon is heavily reliant on the Economic and Physical Burden domains. It effectively uses 'Weight' as a bridge between the Old Testament law and the psychological experience of the Cross. The landscape is deeply traditional but revitalized through sensory language.

revitalisatie_suggesties.doel_metafoor: God made him to be sin
revitalisatie_suggesties.suggestie: Use the 'Container' metaphor more explicitlyâ€”Jesus as the vessel that holds the toxicity of the world.
revitalisatie_suggesties.voorbeeld: Jesus became the very skin and bone of our failure.

coherentie_verbeteringen.resolutie_strategie: Clarify if Jesus is paying God or defeating the Triumvirate to avoid the 'Ransom to Satan' theory.

entailment_checks.problematisch_entailment: If sin is just a weight, it is external to the person.
entailment_checks.aanbeveling: Balance with the 'Sickness' domain to show sin's internal effect on the 'bones'.

alternatieve_domeinen.rationale: To show the Cross as the 'cornerstone' of the new reality mentioned in the text world.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterful use of CMT to bridge the gap between ancient text and modern experience. The 'weighing' metaphor is particularly brilliant.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_esthetiek: Instead of just praising the 'beauty' of the Cry of Dereliction, CMT reveals how the 'Weight' metaphor constructs the logic of the Atonement.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_kolb: Moves beyond 'experience' to the cognitive structures (mappings) that make the experience possible.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_CMT: Reveals that the preacher's 'inadequacy' stems from the breakdown of language when mapping the 'Infinite' (God) to the 'Finite' (Sin).

volledige_metafoor_lijst: burden of all that was despised
appendices.notities: The preacher uses 'Weight' as a primary cognitive anchor to explain the 'strange formulation' of 2 Cor 5:21.
